page.title: 13FLOODING IN HELSTON
page.content: Loe Bar is a large shingle feature lying across the mouth of the River Cober. Behind the shingle bar lies the largest natural freshwater lake in Cornwall. It lies to the south of the town of Helston. To allow water to escape from Loe Pool a tunnel was constructed along the line of an old mine adit. During heavy winter storms in Novenber 1984 this outlet to the sea became blocked causing a build up of water in the lake behind the bar. This caused the lower part of Helston town to be flooded. On Wednesday 5th December, mechanical diggers were moved onto the bar to dig a large trench so that water could flow to the sea and relieve the flooding. Although the trench was later blocked it now, unfortunately, forms a large feature in the bar.
